title: Disney's Sleeping Beauty VHS title
content:
Hi,

As described, am I trying to figure out what font in the title is used of  
the VHS version of Disney's Sleeping Beauty. As far as I know is this the only version where a more distinct Gothic typeface is used.

In the url a sample:

[http://www.catawiki.com/catalog/dvd-video-blu-ray/carriers/vhs-video-tap...](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701104308/http:/www.catawiki.com/catalog/dvd-video-blu-ray/carriers/vhs-video-tape/974049-sleeping-beauty "http://www.catawiki.com/catalog/dvd-video-blu-ray/carriers/vhs-video-tape/974049-sleeping-beauty")

Before I contact the Disney Studio's themselves or Buena Vista Home Entertainment (if they still exist), I want to ask you guys.

Thanx in advance!

Font: 

 Old English Text 

Solved By: 

 [bowfinpw](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701104308/http:/typophile.com/user/2088 "View user profile.")
author: Rune_Emb

comments.content:
Usually the Disney artists adapt existing designs for their purposes. This looks like a simplified rendition of [Old English Text](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701104308/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/old-english-text/?refby=bowfin).

- Mike Yanega

Thanx for the quick reply.

Old English typeface makes sense, sinds its about legend of Arthur.  
Good to know that Disney Artists in general make deviations from  
existing fonts.

The title from Hunchback of Notre Dame i did find at What the Font  
but the one from Sleeping Beauty i didnt.

Maybe more spacing between characters in my image?  
He didnt recognised it, and the Old English type is to be found on My Fonts, so...
